<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Vertex> it = adjList[i].iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
Vertex node = it.next();
if(node.name.equals(u.name))
{
    node.color = "GRAY";
    node.distance = u.distance + 1;
    node.pre = u;
    Q.add(node);
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can store the consecutive values of the iterator by using a variable outside of the loop and assigning the value of Iterator.next() to it in each iteration of the loop.
